citation.article-title: Pedobacter lentus sp. nov. and Pedobacter terricola sp. nov., isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pedobacter terricola sp. nov.
Pedobacter terricola (ter.ri.co′la. L. masc. n. terricola a dweller of soil, referring to the isolation of the type strain from soil).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming, non-flagellated cocci, oval-shaped or rods (0.3–0.6×0.5–5.0 μm); occasionally, a few cells >10.0 μm in length may occur.
Colonies on NA are circular, slightly convex, smooth, glistening, pale orange in colour and 1.0–1.2 mm in diameter after incubation for 7 days at 25 °C.
Optimal growth occurs at 25 °C; growth occurs at 4 and 34 °C, but not at 35 °C.
Optimal pH for growth is 6.5–7.5; growth occurs at pH 5.5 and 8.0, but not at pH 5.0 or 8.5.
Optimal growth occurs in the presence of 0–1.0 % (w/v) NaCl; growth does not occur in the presence of more than 7 % (w/v) NaCl.
Growth does not occur under anaerobic conditions on NA or on NA supplemented with nitrate.
Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80 are hydrolysed, but casein, gelatin, starch, tyrosine, hypoxanthine and xanthine are not.
Sensitive to carbenicillin, cephalothin, lincomycin, neomycin, streptomycin and novobiocin and slightly sensitive to polymyxin B and oleandomycin.
Major fatty acids (>10 % of total fatty acids) are iso-C15 : 0, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH and summed feature 3 (C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH).
The DNA G+C content is 36.8 mol% (HPLC).

The type strain, DS-45T (=KCTC 12876T=JCM 14594T), was isolated from soil from the island of Dokdo, Korea.
